greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 2^(absolute difference between prime factors of n-th semiprime) mod (n-th semiprime).
comment: If A001358(n)=3*p with p>3, then a(n) = (3*p+1)/4 if p == 1 (mod 4), or (9*p+1)/4 if p == 3 (mod 4). (End)
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(1)=1 because the first semiprime is 4=2*2 and (2^(2-2) mod 4)=1.
a(11)=25 because the 11th semiprime is 33=3*11 and (2^(11-3) mod 33)=25.
maple: else for k from b(n-1)+1 while
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Dec 16 2010
